body_html:
This has enough changes in it that I think it can be pulled at this time. If we want to add a selector lib like Reselect, I'd want to split off into a new branch anyway.

In this branch:

  • Object.assigns now use the spread operator
  • Most imports no longer require absolute pathing (see webpack.config.js under resolve: alias)
  • Broke out some controlApp properties into their own stores (notifications, recipes). Example state tree:
{
  controlApp: {
    isFetching: false,
  },
  recipes: {
    list: [],
    selectedRecipe: null,
    recipeListNeedsFetch: true,
  },
  notifications: [],
  // routing, form, ...
}
  • Moved reducer business into reducers/index, which are imported into configureStore
  • Cleaned up some Redux stuff (there was some unnecessary initial state business)
  • Removed the '.js' from imports - webpack automatically handles the extension for us (this might be personal preference)
  • Makes necessary adjustments to reducer tests
title: Webpack/Redux Refactor + Cleanup
